page.title: 18Coal Mining in Harraton.
page.content: {Harraton pit}is now{closed}but the mineral railway track still remains.A man tending a grave in St George's churchyard remembered being told that the mine opened in{1640.}He lived in{Office Row,Rickleton.}These houses used to be the{miner's cottages.}He worked in the pit at Chester Moor. {Simon Bridgett writes: Working down a coal mine in the old days was not much fun.It's hard to get up early when you are little.Boys,men and women worked down the mine.The ones who opened the doors were only 5 or 6 years old.The miners told them stories about ghosts and they got scared and lonely.It was very dark but if you lit a match it would blow up because of the gas.There were brackets to keep up the roof.Boys pulled trucks but if you didn't work hard your Dad spanked you because he got less money.
